meaningMnemonic:
You've got lots of <kanji>heavy</kanji> things, so the only logical thing is <vocabulary>to stack</vocabulary> them all up. 

Besides heavy physical things, you can also use this word when you're going <vocabulary>to accumulate</vocabulary> things like experience, practice, or years on your back.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

All the things you've <vocabulary>stack</vocabulary>ed up were in preparation for your new <reading>casa</reading> (かさ). With everything inside boxes and neatly piled up, you're finally ready to move into your new casa. Hooray!
